english: poplar; surname Yang; aspen; a kind of tree

etymology.description: semantic: 木 ("tree, wood") + phonetic: 昜; simplified from 楊 (昜 → 𠃓).
etymology.interpretation: Combines the wood element with the phonetic yáng (昜) to signal a tree whose name is pronounced yáng. In simplification, the phonetic was reduced to 𠃓 while keeping 木, preserving both meaning and sound with fewer strokes.
etymology.simplification: Replaced the phonetic 昜 with the abbreviated component 𠃓 to reduce strokes and match the series seen in 阳, while retaining the semantic 木.

examples.chinese: 我家院子里有一排白杨(我家院子裡有一排白楊)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ jiā yuànzi lǐ yǒu yī pái bái yáng.
examples.english: There is a row of poplars in my yard.

examples.chinese: 杨先生来自北京(楊先生來自北京)。
秋风一吹，杨叶沙沙作响(秋風一吹，楊葉沙沙作響)。
examples.pinyin: Qiūfēng yī chuī, yáng yè shāshā zuòxiǎng.
examples.english: When the autumn wind blows, poplar leaves rustle.
